articles.headline: In Girl’s Account, Rite at St. Paul’s Boarding School Turned Into Rape
articles.snippet: The second day of testimony in the trial of Owen Labrie, who has pleaded not guilty, brought out both excruciating detail and intense emotion from the girl said to have been sexually assaulted.
articles.abstract: The second day of testimony in the trial of Owen Labrie, who has pleaded not guilty, brought out both excruciating detail and intense emotion from the girl said to have been sexually assaulted.
articles.lead_paragraph: CONCORD, N.H. — The 16-year-old girl sat on the witness stand, her hair pulled back. She tried to speak steadily as she told a jury about the night when a ritual at St. Paul’s — an elite boarding school here — turned into what she described as a shocking sexual assault.

articles.headline: Baby Boomers Ready to Sell Businesses to the Next Generation
articles.snippet: As older owners choose the improved economy as a climate in which to sell, the buyers are putting a more diverse face on small businesses.
articles.abstract: As older owners choose the improved economy as a climate in which to sell, the buyers are putting a more diverse face on small businesses.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dan Bizzarro and Bill Jordan were still in college when they went to work at the Bimac Corporation, a castings manufacturer in Dayton, Ohio. After graduation, they joined full time as manufacturing and engineering executives. And eventually they teamed with a third employee to buy the business.

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Presses Civil Rights Agenda in Local Courts
articles.snippet: The government has waded into cases involving legal aid, transgender students, juvenile prisoners and people who take videos of police officers.
articles.abstract: The government has waded into cases involving legal aid, transgender students, juvenile prisoners and people who take videos of police officers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Burlington, Wash., was a small city fighting what seemed like a local lawsuit. Three poor people said that their public lawyers were too overworked to adequately represent them in municipal court cases. The dispute went mostly unnoticed for two years, until the Obama administration became involved.

articles.headline: Uber Missed Criminal Records of Drivers, Prosecutors Assert
articles.snippet: District attorneys in Los Angeles and San Francisco say drivers for the ride-hailing service have included some convicted of murder or sex offenses.
articles.abstract: District attorneys in Los Angeles and San Francisco say drivers for the ride-hailing service have included some convicted of murder or sex offenses.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For more than a year, regulators in various cities have questioned whether Uber, the ride-hailing service, vets its drivers for criminal backgrounds as carefully as traditional taxi companies.

articles.headline: Oil Companies Sit on Hands at Auction for Leases
articles.snippet: The low turnout at the Gulf of Mexico auction was the clearest sign yet that the fortunes of oil companies are skidding so fast that they now must reduce plans for production well into the future.
articles.abstract: The low turnout at the Gulf of Mexico auction was the clearest sign yet that the fortunes of oil companies are skidding so fast that they now must reduce plans for production well into the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — With oil prices collapsing and companies in retrenchment, a federal auction in the Gulf of Mexico on Wednesday attracted the lowest interest from producers since 1986.

articles.headline: Union Takes a McDonald’s Challenge Overseas
articles.snippet: A union-led effort to raise wages at the fast-food chain is taking its campaign abroad, hoping to bring further pressure on the company.
articles.abstract: A union-led effort to raise wages at the fast-food chain is taking its campaign abroad, hoping to bring further pressure on the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: McDonald’s long ago went global. Lately, the anti-McDonald’s campaign has started following it around the world.

articles.headline: Ailing Jimmy Carter ‘at Ease With Whatever Comes’
articles.snippet: Jimmy Carter, still sprightly at 90 years old, spoke about his cancer diagnosis, innovative treatment regimen and born-again Christian beliefs.
articles.abstract: Jimmy Carter, still sprightly at 90 years old, spoke about his cancer diagnosis, innovative treatment regimen and born-again Christian beliefs.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The 39th president of the United States walked into the crowded room on Thursday, slightly stooped at 90 years old, but nimble as a cat. He flashed the fleshy smile that once launched a thousand caricatures.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: Canadian Maple Syrup ‘Rebels’ Clash With Law
articles.snippet: Harvesters in Quebec, who provide 70 percent of the world’s supply, must sell through a central system, but some flout the requirement.
articles.abstract: Harvesters in Quebec, who provide 70 percent of the world’s supply, must sell through a central system, but some flout the requirement.
articles.lead_paragraph: The scenic and narrow lane that leads to Robert Hodge’s sugar camp is surrounded by a cat’s cradle of plastic piping that draws sap from 12,000 trees. At the end of the lane, a ramshackle hut contains reverse osmosis pumps to concentrate the harvest. A stainless steel evaporator, about the size of a truck, finishes the conversion into maple syrup.

articles.headline: Maker of Addyi, ‘Female Viagra’ Drug, Being Sold to Valeant for $1 Billion
articles.snippet: The deal for Sprout Pharmaceuticals came after the Food and Drug Administration granted approval this week for Addyi, a new libido drug for women.
articles.abstract: The deal for Sprout Pharmaceuticals came after the Food and Drug Administration granted approval this week for Addyi, a new libido drug for women.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sprout Pharmaceuticals, which on Tuesday won regulatory approval for the first pill to aid a woman’s sex drive, will be acquired by Valeant Pharmaceuticals International for about $1 billion in cash.
articles.byline: By Andrew Pollack and Chad Bray
